---
title: "rules.yaml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines configuration rules for Spectral, an API linting tool. It extends the recommended OpenAPI Specification (OAS) ruleset and disables the `paths-kebab-case` rule.

## Symbols

### `extends`
#### Description
This key specifies that the current ruleset extends the recommended OpenAPI Specification (OAS) ruleset provided by Spectral.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| spectral:oas,recommended | array | A nested array containing the string "spectral:oas,recommended" |

### `rules`
#### Description
This key defines custom rule configurations that override or supplement the extended ruleset.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| paths-kebab-case | boolean | A boolean value set to `false` to disable the `paths-kebab-case` rule |

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| Spectral | API linting tool used for enforcing API design rules and best practices |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| paths-kebab-case | boolean | false | Disables the rule that enforces kebab-case for API paths |

## Error Handling
This configuration file does not implement specific error handling. Any syntax errors in the YAML file would be caught by the Spectral linter itself when parsing the configuration.

## API/Interface Reference
This configuration file does not expose an API. It is used to configure the behavior of the Spectral linter when analyzing API specifications.
